Shape Ops¶

class sknet.ops.Reshape(incoming, new_shape, **kwargs)[source]¶

reshape of the input accoridng to a given shape. This layer allows to transform the shape of an input by reshaping the input according to a given shape

Parameters:
  • incoming (Op or tuple of int) – input shape of incoming Op object
  • new_shape (tuple of int) – the shape to use to reshape the input
class sknet.ops.Merge(incomings, func)[source]¶

merge multiple inputs into one according to some function. This layer allows to take multiple inputs and aggregate them (merge them) into a single one via some function with signature func(list_of_tensors)->tensor or according to elementwise sum or elementwise maximum. The shape of the inputs must be the same.

Example of use:

a_shape = [10,1,32,32]
b_shape = [10,1,32,32]
# element wise sum
Merge([a_shape,b_shape],func="SUM")
# with a predefined function for example performing softmax
# pooling over the tensors
def my_func(lots):
    stacked = tf.nn.softmax(tf.stack(lots,-1))
    return tf.reduce_sum(stacked,-1)
Merge([a_shape,b_shape],func=my_func)
Parameters:
  • incoming (list) – list of input shapes or instances of Op
  • func (func or str) – function to use to merge the inputs can be either a function of "MAX", "MIN", "AVG", "SUM"
class sknet.ops.Stack(incomings, axis, **kwargs)[source]¶

stack multiple inputs into one. This layer stacks multiple inputs into one by stacking them along a specified axis.

Parameters:
  • incomings (list) – list of Op instances or shapes
  • axis (int) – axis along which the inputs are stacked
class sknet.ops.ExpandDim(incoming, axis, **kwargs)[source]¶

add an extra dimension in the input.

This layer allows to add an extra dimension in the input specified by axis

example of use:

input_shape = [10,32,32]
layer = ExpandDim(input_shape,1)
layer.out_shape #[10,1,32,32]
Parameters:
  • incoming (shape or Op instance) – the input shape of the layer
  • axis (int) – the axis to expand dim on
class sknet.ops.Concat(incomings, axis, **kwargs)[source]¶

concatenate multiple inputs into one according to a given axis. This layer allows to take multiple inputs and concatenates them along a given axis. The inputs must have same shape for all the dimension other than axis.

Parameters:
  • incomings (list) – the list of Op or input shapes to be concatenated
  • axis (int) – the axis to concatenate over with
